title: Some elements have a `[tabindex]` value greater than 0
description: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://web.dev/tabindex/).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has a tabindex greater than 0

node.snippet: <button tabindex="1" class="usa-accordion__button usa-banner__button inside-nav" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="gov-banner" aria-label="Here’s how you know">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has a tabindex greater than 0

node.snippet: <input tabindex="2" type="search" autocomplete="off" class="usa-input extended-mega-search-field-small margin-bottom-2 margin-right-ne…" id="query2" name="query" value="Search FDIC.gov" onblur="if(this.value == '') {this.value = 'Search FDIC.gov';}" onfocus="if(this.value == 'Search FDIC.gov') {this.value = '';}">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has a tabindex greater than 0

node.snippet: <button tabindex="3" name="commit2" type="submit" class="usa-button submit" id="searchsubmit2" aria-label="Submit Search Request" value="">
